arm_group.description: 20g Kelloggs Special K cereal with 83ml semi-skimmed milk
40g Kelloggs Special K cereal with 166ml semi-skimmed milk

brief_summary.textblock:
Both regular exercise and breakfast consumption have well known health benefits. Consuming
      breakfast prior to morning exercise may influence appetite, mood and cognitive function
      later in the day. The purpose of this study is to test whether the amount of food consumed
      at breakfast prior to exercise influences these parameters in active women.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Effect of Breakfast Size Prior to Morning Exercise on Cognition, Mood and Appetite in Habitually Active Women

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Must be habitually active (exercising for least 30 minutes, 3 times per week for at
             least the previous 6 months)

          -  Must have a normal exercise routine includes a minimum of 1 morning exercise session
             (which takes place between 6am-11am) each week

          -  Must run on a regular basis (at least once per week) and be able to run at a moderate
             pace for 30 minutes non-stop on a treadmill

          -  Must consume breakfast on most days of the week, usually consume breakfast before
             undertaking a morning exercise session and be comfortable consuming a bowl of cereal
             45mins before running

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  English not first language

          -  Smoking

          -  Previous or current eating disorders, metabolic disorders, gastric problems or any
             contraindications of exercise.

          -  Pregnancy

          -  The habitual use of some prescription or over the counter medications (excluding
             contraception) or herbal/dietary supplements (please ask the researcher)

          -  A history of or current learning difficulties, ADHD or dyslexia

          -  Daily use of an inhaler to control asthma

          -  Allergies or intolerances to any of the foods provided in the study (Special K
             cereal, semi-skimmed milk, pasta, tomato sauce, cheese, olive oil, rice, custard)

facility.name: Brain, Performance and Nutrition Research Centre, Northumbria Univerity

clinical_study.official_title: The Effect of Breakfast Size Prior to Morning Exercise on Cognition, Mood and Appetite Later in the Day in Habitually Active Women

other_outcome.description: Appetite will be assessed using Visual Analogue Scales (VAS) immediately before each set of cognitive tasks.
other_outcome.time_frame: Assessed hourly until 4.5 hours and at 6.5 and 10.5 hours

primary_outcome.description: Participants will complete 4 cognitive tasks (Four Choice Reaction Time, NBack, Stroop and RVIP) measuring reaction time, short-term memory, speed of processing and attention.
primary_outcome.measure: Cognitive function change from baseline scores
primary_outcome.time_frame: Assessed hourly until 4.5 hours and at 6.5 and 10.5 hours

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: Mood will be assessed using Visual Analogue Scales (VAS) immediately before and after each set of cognitive tasks.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessed hourly until 4.5 hours and at 6.5 and 10.5 hours

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Intervention Model: Crossover Assignment, Masking: Open Label
